_references: IL DHS MSP Application Info: https://www.dhs.state.il.us/?item=33698

program.name: Medicare Savings Program (MSP)
program.description:
Medicare is health insurance for people 65 and older. It is also for younger people with some disabilities. Medicare has two main parts:
- Part A helps pay for hospital stays.
- Part B helps pay for doctor visits.

People pay a monthly fee called a premium to keep their Medicare. MSP helps pay these premiums if you have a low income.

How much help you get depends on your income:
- Very low income: MSP pays your Part A and Part B premiums, plus your deductibles (the amount you pay before Medicare starts paying) and the copayments and coinsurance you pay when you get care.
- A little higher income: MSP pays your Part B premium only.

The estimated savings shown above only includes your premium savings. Your actual savings could be much higher if you qualify for the very low income level, which also covers your deductibles and other costs when you get care.

The estimated savings shown above assume you or your spouse worked at least 10 years, which automatically makes Part A free. This is true for about 99% of people with Medicare.

To apply, you must already be enrolled in Medicare. Click 'Apply Now' to learn how to apply online, by mail, by phone, or in person.
program.website_description: Help paying Medicare premiums and costs

documents.text: Proof of identity (ex: driver's license, state ID, birth certificate)
Proof of residence (ex: utility bill, lease, or mail with your name and address)
Social Security numbers for all people on your application

navigators.name: IDHS Family Community Resource Center
navigators.description: Visit your local Family Community Resource Center to apply in person or get help with your MSP application. Use the link to find an office near you: select 'Family Community Resource Center' as the office type, then select your county.

navigators.name: Get Covered Illinois
navigators.description: Get Covered Illinois offers free help with your MSP application. Trained helpers can meet with you online, in person, or by phone. They speak over 250 languages.

navigators.name: Illinois SHIP (Senior Health Insurance Program)
navigators.description: SHIP provides free Medicare counseling and can help you understand and apply for Medicare Savings Programs. Counselors are trained volunteers who can assist by phone or in person.
